relation: There are plenty of things to do for fun around. Here on campus, we have a game room in the student life center. There are a variety of events that the school provides such as outdoor movies and cultural events, like plays and art shows. Campus is located at the foot of the mountains so there are plenty of outdoor things to do, like biking, rafting, hiking, etc.

On campus, there are three locations to eat. The main one is the cafeteria. In the cafeteria, there are several options. There is always a homestyle option, the entree varies from day to day. Also, there is a pizza and pasta station, a sandwich station, a grill, a salad station, cereal station and of course, the dessert bar. Downstairs from the cafeteria, is the '63/'64 grill (otherwise known as the 'stud'). They offer a variety of options, much like a fast food restaurant. The third option is Einstein's. Einstein's is a small coffee shop which offers breakfast and lunch items like bagels and sandwiches.

Campus is pretty small so most of the dorm buildings are located near all the academic buildings. The dorm building i live in is beautiful. All the rooms come with a microfridge, so that's a plus. On our hall, is a laundry room. All the girls on my hall are super nice, as are most people on campus.

The class sizes here are small. In most of my classes, there have been about 15-25 students with a professor. The Professors are always willing to help because their goal is to make sure we actually learn something from their class. On campus, there are different labs that you can attend to get extra help in classes you may be struggling in. There are also free tutors for those who need them.
Coming to North Greenville University was one of the best decisions i have ever made. I truly feel at home here.

NGU is a lot like high school, without the dramatics and with much more freedom. Tips for prospective students Do not come to NGU if you are not willing to follow the rules listed in the handbook. You will not enjoy yourself, and you will probably get kicked out. Bang for the buck Though there are many generous scholarships for residents of South Carolina, the tuition at NGU is not unreasonable for a private, Christian university. The dorm rooms are nice, and many are new. The education is good, and the cafeteria holds a variety of tasteful food for every meal. NGU students receive free access to every home athletic event.
